intro: Russelia deamii, commonly known as the yellow mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, tubular yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with dark green, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Russelia deamii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
